pages.title: AIM 2026 Conference
pages.content: The AIM Health R&D Summit brings together academia, industry, and the military to promote collaboration in the development of life-saving battlefield technologies. Combining two events‚ÄìMilitary Medical Industry Day, BexarBio pitch competition, and the San Antonio Military Health and Universities Research Forum‚ÄìAIM brings together top minds from across the life sciences ecosystem to advance the military‚Äôs medical mission.

pages.title: Executive Meeting Notes
pages.content:
Convention Center Notes: 
Rooms 301-305 are available June 7-9,  2026
June 21-23, 2026 availability in Stars at Night Ballroom and meeting rooms 301-305

Research: 
Instead of making the early bird sizeable and limited, we extend discounts, as this would make the decision materialize suddenly.
This is a $300 discount. Is it enough to move people to commit early? Probably.
What‚Äôs in it for me to make that early decision?
I love the use of team tickets to incentivize sales. The discount is more substantial. The common issue with team tickets is the lack of reasons why I should attend as a team.
What do I get by bringing you 10 people? Are you giving me a room to meet? Special access?

pages.title: Important Information
pages.content:
Contract: 



## Contract Notes: 
‚Ä¢ Rental includes one set-up per day (theatre, classroom, banquet seating or conference style). Set up includes
chairs, 8‚Äôx15‚Äù classroom tables, 6‚Äôx30‚Äù & 8‚Äôx30‚Äù tables (for head tables and handouts), 66‚Äù round tables, and
one lectern
‚Ä¢ Rental includes one set-up per day (theatre, classroom, banquet seating or conference style). Set up includes
chairs, 8‚Äôx15‚Äù classroom tables, 6‚Äôx30‚Äù & 8‚Äôx30‚Äù tables (for head tables and handouts), 66‚Äù round tables, and
one lectern
‚Ä¢ Rental includes normal A/C or heating, excluding move-in and move-out times. A/C or heating is at an
additional fee during move-in and move-out times.



‚Ä¢ No helium balloons allowed in any of the spaces. Balloons must be inflated with air
‚Ä¢ Change-Overs/Set-ups:  Meeting room rental includes one (1) setup per day. Mid-day changes result in a charge equivalent to the rental cost for all additional equipment in the resulting set up.  For more details, please contact your Events Services Coordinator. Equipment rates in effect at time of signed contract will apply. 
‚Ä¢ Drapes, decorations, buntings, and other decorative materials must be fire retardant materials properly treated to meet flame-proofing requirements and must have the prior approval of the City‚Äôs Fire Marshal. The hanging of items weighing less than 250 lbs. can be performed by PSAV, your general services contractor (decorator), or another qualified provider.  
‚Ä¢ The rigging of items in the Convention Center that weigh over 250 lbs. must be reviewed and approved by PSAV ‚Äì the exclusive provider of rigging services ‚Äì and PSAV must supply and hang everything from the chain hoist/motor up to the ceiling.

Convention Center > Facilities (sahbgcc.com)

pages.title: Week 1 KBYG
pages.content:
Subject: ‚úàÔ∏è Know Before You Go ‚Äì San Antonio Trip Details

Hi [First Name],
We‚Äôre looking forward to welcoming you to San Antonio next week! Below you‚Äôll find everything you need to know before you arrive. Please take a moment to review your travel and lodging details, along with a few local favorites to check out while you're in town. Once reviewed, let me know if you have any additional questions. 

### ‚úàÔ∏è Arrival Information
Flight Details
‚úàÔ∏è Airline: [Insert Airline]
üõ´ Departure City: [Insert City]
üïí Departure Time: [Insert Time]
üõ¨ Arrival in San Antonio: [Insert Time]

### üöó Transportation from the Airport
San Antonio International Airport has Uber and Lyft services readily available. Please note that Aiden Hotel does not offer a shuttle, so rideshare will be the best option to get to your hotel.

### üè® Lodging Information
Aiden Hotel by Best Western
üìç 1103 E Commerce St, San Antonio, TX 78205
Your reservation is under your name. Room and tax are covered by VelocityTX, but you will need to provide a credit card at check-in for incidentals.

### üçΩÔ∏è Local Favorites ‚Äì Downtown San Antonio
Here are some great spots nearby to grab a bite or unwind:
‚Ä¢ The Rendezvous @ Aiden Riverwalk ‚Äì Cozy spot right in the hotel
‚Ä¢ Tokyo Cowboy ‚Äì Japanese whiskey bar meets Texas steakhouse
‚Ä¢ Fiume Pizzeria and Wine Bar ‚Äì Wood-fired pizza and wine
‚Ä¢ Iron Cactus ‚Äì Elevated Tex-Mex with a rooftop patio
‚Ä¢ Down on Grayson ‚Äì American eats in a trendy atmosphere

### üìö¬†Learning Sessions 
‚Ä¢ Transportation: We‚Äôll pick you up from the hotel at 11:15 AM and take you to VelocityTX. Transportation back to the hotel will also be provided at the end of the day, so there's no need to arrange your own travel.
‚Ä¢ Dress Code: The dress code while attending in person sessions is business casual 
‚Ä¢ Required Items: Laptop & Charger, Notebook, Pen or Pencil 


If you have any questions or need assistance before your trip, feel free to reach out. Safe travels ‚Äì we can‚Äôt wait to see you in San Antonio!
Warm regards,
[Your Name]
[Your Title / VelocityTX Team]
[Contact Info]

Let me know if you'd like this turned into a branded PDF or newsletter-style version as well!

pages.title: Cohort Pre-Program Communications
pages.content: KNOW BEFORE YOU GO - WEEK 1

pages.title: 09.29.25 - 10.17.25  MHM Accelerator Program
pages.content:
Presented in partnership with Methodist Healthcare Ministries of South Texas, the Community Health Accelerator promotes awareness, research, and innovation related to the social determinants of health (SDOH). In addressing these non-medical factors that impact personal wellness, this first-of-its-kind program seeks to advance health equity in communities across South Texas and beyond.
The Community Health Accelerator is tailored to startups that are working to commercialize innovations that address disparities in education and socioeconomic status, among other factors, and will provide a collaborative and nurturing environment to accelerate the development of these technologies.





## üìì IMPORTANT NOTES: 
Videography SOW: 
MHM Accelerator (social reel, Accelerator specific video [:30-:45] and catalogued b-roll)
MHM Demo Day (social reel and catalogued b-roll)
SDOH Evergreen Video (up to 2 Minutes)
Year 2 Program Recap Video (up to 2 Minutes)


 
## Harvey Castro Welcome Email

pages.title: Lina Rugova (Emerge & Rise and Founders Institute)
pages.content:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/linagrugova/ - profile 
https://emergeandrise.org/
mailto:lina@linarugova.com

Bio: 
Founder & President, Emerge and Rise
Lina Rugova is a community development leader focused on social innovation and economic equity. As the founder of Emerge and Rise, a nonprofit venture development organization based in San Antonio, she supports underserved entrepreneurs through business readiness, digital adoption, and financial empowerment. Her work addresses the Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) by creating real access to resources that improve economic mobility, mental well-being, and long-term business sustainability.
Lina brings over 15 years of consulting experience and serves as a faculty member in the Business Management Department at Palo Alto College. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Business and a Master of Management in Corporate Innovation and Entrepreneurship from Penn State University and is currently pursuing a Doctorate in Business Administration with a focus on entrepreneurship with a social impact focus.

Travel Accommodations:

pages.title: Daniyal Liaqat (Tabiat)
pages.content:
Direct Email: daniyal@tabiat.care
Bio:
Daniyal Liaqat is the CEO and Co-Founder of Tabiat, where he is pioneering AI-powered digital health programs for chronic disease management. With a PhD and Postdoctoral Fellowship from the University of Toronto and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence, Daniyal partners with healthcare organizations to transform cutting-edge research into practical solutions that address clinical needs and the social determinants of health. Currently, Tabiat is focused on building next-generation digital tools for COPD‚Äîone of the world‚Äôs leading causes of death and hospitalization, affecting over 16 million Americans‚Äîwith the goal of advancing equitable, personalized care for patients everywhere.

Notes:
‚Ä¢ Travel plans:

pages.title: 09.04.25 Univision Video Production
pages.content:
Univision will host their first private concert in San Antonio in over 15 years on Thursday, September 4th, at the historic Aztec Theatre. Doors open at 7:00 PM, with the performance beginning at 9:00 PM. 434 Media will shoot two video assets for sponsors of this concert - Davis Law & Cavender Toyota. The production team will have full-day access to the venue, arriving at 5:00 PM to begin setup and capture B-roll footage.



## üìì IMPORTANT NOTES: 


### Davis Law Firm Video Requirements
‚Ä¢ Capturing winner's journey for their "register to win" meet and greet contest
‚Ä¢ Winner arrives early (around 6:00 PM) for pre-event captures
‚Ä¢ Red carpet with step and repeat in the Aztec foyer area
‚Ä¢ Lorena from Univision will host and conduct interviews
‚Ä¢ Testimonial from winner with Lorena (needs to be mic'd up)
‚Ä¢ Capture the meet and greet with Alejandro (planned for around 8:00 PM)
‚Ä¢ Video will have Hispanic Heritage Month theme
‚Ä¢ Vertical filming specifically for social media
‚Ä¢ Delivery deadline: Before September 15th
‚Ä¢ Daisy will supply interview questions
### Cavender Toyota Video Requirements
‚Ä¢ Capturing VIP experience with first two rows of mezzanine seating (80 people)
‚Ä¢ 360 photo booth with step and repeat inside venue
‚Ä¢ Capture content of guests waiting in line and using photo booth
‚Ä¢ VIP seating footage with Cavender Toyota branding
‚Ä¢ Tundra arrival footage with Carolina (Cavender paid program host)
‚Ä¢ No moderator - all visual B-roll content
‚Ä¢ Video for social media recap with Hispanic Heritage theme
‚Ä¢ Will run during Hispanic Heritage Month (Sept 15-Oct 15)
### Additional Content with Stacy
‚Ä¢ Behind-the-scenes footage and secondary interview element
‚Ä¢ Additional crowd testimonials
‚Ä¢ Capturing cultural significance of Alejandro and his father Vicente Fernandez
‚Ä¢ Creating deeper connection to Hispanic heritage and generational impact
‚Ä¢ Supporting content for sponsors and Vemos Vamos
### Logistics and Resources
‚Ä¢ Need all-access credentials for team to move freely throughout venue
‚Ä¢ Capture footage of Miller VIP section and Univision VIP area
‚Ä¢ Follow-up meetings scheduled for August 6th and 20th - Creative Team Call

pages.title: DEVSA Event Roadmap with 434 MEDIA
pages.content:
With a focus on building authentic connections in the tech space, DEVSA has quickly become the place for passionate tech enthusiasts of all skill levels to connect, learn, and grow in a safe, inclusive, and welcoming environment.
2025: Expanding Our Reach and Impact
Building on this momentum, DEVSA is thrilled to announce our 2025 event roadmap, which includes an exciting new partnership with 434 MEDIA!
434 MEDIA connects enterprises, people, places, and innovations through creative media and smart marketing in San Antonio. Their impressive network includes VelocityTX's Innovation Showcase, The Health Cell's State of the Industry, the AIM Health R&D Summit, Tech Bloc‚Äôs San Antonio Tech Day, Methodist Healthcare Ministries, Salute to Troops, and many more.
This year, DEVSA will spotlight tech innovators from the 434 MEDIA network, featuring speakers from both their ranks and the DEVSA community. But that's not all!
We're joining forces with 434 MEDIA to launch our first-ever hackathon! This exciting event will connect startups from the 434 MEDIA network with the talented techies of DEVSA, offering incredible opportunities for networking, collaboration and innovation. And yes, there will be some seriously exciting prizes for the winners
We can't wait to share the full 2025 event schedule with you so stay tuned for more details and get ready for another year of connection, learning, and growth with DEVSA!


MARCH
APRIL
MAY
JUNE
JULY

AUGUST
SEPEMBER

OCTOBER

NOVEMBER
  



OCT - SASW
‚Ä¢ Note from Nichole: Gabe was just mentioning that he would like to get 434 involved in SASW. This would be a great way to potentially have a track for this one? 

DEVSA TRACKS FROM TECH DAY LAST YEAR
Speaker:
Crystal Poenisch
Topic: Navigating the Cloud-Native Landscape

Speaker:
Ryan Orsinger
Topic: Building a Data Science Toolchain with R and Python

Speakers:
Rachel Davis
and

pages.title: Digital Canvas connection to 434 MEDIA
pages.content:
Digital Canvas, a new 434 Media production, explores the dynamic intersection of art, technology, and music. Imagine a vibrant event series, hosted and emceed by Vemos Vamos, spotlighting the creative energy happening right here in San Antonio and the South Texas region.
Digital Canvas isn't just a showcase; it's a vibrant hub for learning and connection. Each event will feature tech talks focused on the cutting-edge tools and programming powering these creative fields ‚Äì think of it as DEVSA with a live music twist! We're bringing that same community focus on learning and networking, but adding a whole new dimension of artistic expression.
With "URL to IRL," Digital Canvas will celebrate the incredible talent within our community. From students and photographers to videographers, animators, UI/UX designers, AI specialists, and more, we'll be showcasing the diverse skills and backgrounds that make our region so unique. And because San Antonio is Military City USA, we're especially excited to spotlight creatives with prior military connections now thriving in the art, tech, and music scene. This aligns perfectly with our partnership with the AMPD Project, a veteran-founded non-profit empowering students and veterans through media and entertainment.
Digital Canvas events will be premiere ticketed experiences, helping us cover production costs and ensure the series' sustainability. Even better, any extra proceeds will go directly to the AMPD Project, fueling their mission of educational access, career development, and entrepreneurial opportunities for veterans and students in the creative fields. We're not just building an event series; we're building a movement. We envision Digital Canvas becoming a cornerstone of the San Antonio creative ecosystem, connecting and inspiring individuals across all disciplines.


Additional Statement Wording: 
# üí• BREAKING NEWS üí•
### Introducing Digital Canvas: A Thrilling New Event Series from 434 Media Showcasing Art, Tech, and Music in San Antonio
San Antonio, TX ‚Äì 434 Media proudly presents Digital Canvas, an electrifying new event series that explores the dynamic intersection of art, technology, and music. Hosted and emceed by the vibrant Vemos Vamos, Digital Canvas is more than just a showcase‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement that brings together creators, innovators, and visionaries from across San Antonio and the South Texas region.
Imagine a space where live music, cutting-edge technology, and creative expression collide. Digital Canvas will feature engaging tech talks, diving into the latest tools and programming fueling today‚Äôs creative industries‚Äîthink DEVSA meets live music. It's an immersive experience designed to educate, connect, and inspire.
### From URL to IRL: A Celebration of Local Talent
At the heart of Digital Canvas is "URL to IRL," a celebration of the incredible talent within our community. Whether you're a student, photographer, videographer, animator, UI/UX designer, AI specialist, or another creative mind, Digital Canvas is your platform. In a city renowned as Military City USA, we're especially proud to spotlight veteran creatives now thriving in the world of art, tech, and music.
This mission is amplified through our partnership with the AMPD Project, a veteran-founded nonprofit dedicated to empowering students and veterans through media and entertainment.
### An Event with Purpose
Digital Canvas events will be premiere ticketed experiences, ensuring top-tier production while supporting a greater cause. Proceeds beyond production costs will directly benefit the AMPD Project, fueling their mission to provide educational access, career development, and entrepreneurial opportunities for veterans and students in creative fields.
### Join the Movement
Digital Canvas isn‚Äôt just another event‚Äîit‚Äôs a cornerstone of the San Antonio creative ecosystem. We‚Äôre building a space where art, tech, and music collide in unforgettable ways, sparking collaboration, inspiration, and innovation.
Get ready to experience Digital Canvas‚Äîwhere creativity comes to life.

Stay tuned for event details and ticket announcements!

For media inquiries or sponsorship opportunities, please email jesse@434media.com

pages.title: 08.18.25 - 08.29. 25 MHM Accelerator Program
pages.content:
Presented in partnership with Methodist Healthcare Ministries of South Texas, the Community Health Accelerator promotes awareness, research, and innovation related to the social determinants of health (SDOH). In addressing these non-medical factors that impact personal wellness, this first-of-its-kind program seeks to advance health equity in communities across South Texas and beyond.
The Community Health Accelerator is tailored to startups that are working to commercialize innovations that address disparities in education and socioeconomic status, among other factors, and will provide a collaborative and nurturing environment to accelerate the development of these technologies.

pages.title: Asset Management
pages.content:
# VIDEO Requirements
Best practices for hosting video files and managing the biggest impact on monthly cost - BANDWIDTH 
Additional Tips (Web):
# Image Requirements
Responsive Images
‚Ä¢ Provide images in multiple sizes:
‚Ä¢ Consistent Naming: Use a clear naming convention (i.e., "imagename-large.jpg", "imagename-medium.jpg", "imagename-small.jpg")
Static Images:
‚Ä¢ JPEG: Suitable for photographs and images with many colors and smooth gradients. Offers good compression with minimal quality loss.
‚Ä¢ PNG: Ideal for images with sharp edges, text, and logos. Supports transparency and lossless compression (maintaining original image quality).
‚Ä¢ WebP: A modern format that often provides better compression than JPEG or PNG, but browser support might be limited.
Animation Use Cases (Web):
‚Ä¢ SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics): Best for simple animations, logos, and icons. Vector graphics are resolution-independent, making them suitable for high-resolution displays.
‚Ä¢ GIF: Suitable for simple animations with limited color palettes.
‚Ä¢ WebP: Also supports animation and can offer better compression than GIF.
Caching (Web)
‚Ä¢ Browser Caching: Utilize browser caching headers (e.g., Cache-Control) to instruct browsers to store images locally. This reduces the need to download the same image repeatedly.
‚Ä¢ CDN Caching: Utilize a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to cache images on servers closer to users, reducing latency and bandwidth consumption - CLOUDFLARE or AWS
Lazy Loading (Web)
‚Ä¢ Only load images that are visible within the user's viewport. This prevents unnecessary data downloads
HTML Attributes to use (Web)
‚Ä¢ srcset Attribute: This HTML attribute allows you to specify different image sources for different screen sizes.

# 434 Media Overall Workflow Process
```
graph TD
  %% Customer Mapping %%
  P[PROSPECT BASE UPDATES]:::orange
  PITCHED:::green
  CONTACTED:::red
	B[CUSTOMER MOVES TO PENDING BASE]:::blue
	WON:::green 
	NEGOTIATING:::yellow 
	LOST:::red
  W[PROJECT MANAGER WORKFLOW BEGINS]:::purple
  D[HIDES THE RECORD FROM PENDING BASE]:::orange
  F([Approved Production added to Google Calendar]):::green
  Q[Notion Environment Created]:::orange
  T[Airtable Environment Created]:::orange
  S[Create Project Folder in Google Drive]:::orange
  E[Quickbooks Environment Updated or Created]:::orange
  I[(Invoice Sent)]:::green
  G[(W9 Sent)]:::green
  Z[(ACH Info Sent)]:::green 
  H[Payment reminders set to be sent through Quickbooks]:::red
  R[SALES ASSOCIATE ENTERS CUSTOMER IN PROSPECT BASE]:::green
  
  H ---|FINAL PAYMENT RECEIVED FROM CLIENT| U[CONCLUSION OF PRODUCTION]:::green
  K([Updates Made by PM Until Work Complete]):::purple 
  K --- U

R --- P
P ---|SALES SELECTS| PITCHED & CONTACTED 
PITCHED ---> |AUTOMATION| B
B --- |SALES SELECTS| WON & NEGOTIATING & LOST 
WON --- W
LOST ---> |AUTOMATION| D  
W ---> F
F --->  Q & S & T & E
E --- I & G & Z 
Q ---K
S --- K
T --- K
I --- H


  %% Colors %% 
classDef blue fill:#2374f7,stroke:#000,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff
classDef pink fill:#eb3dd6,stroke:#000,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff
classDef orange fill:#fc822b,stroke:#000,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff

	classDef yellow fill:#ffd230,stroke:#000,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff
```
### Interfaces/Dashboards/Reporting/Views
to do list - from prospect, pending and PM task bases, grouped by Prospect, Pending, Tasks: company, next contact date or due date, task description (for tasks)
pending revenue - from pending base: company, pitched, timing, dollars in a negotiating or blank disposition
closed won/closed lost - from pending base, grouped by closed won and closed lost: company, pitched, timing, dollars
Interfaces/Dashboards/Reporting/Views

pages.title: Mission & Values
pages.content:
Company Presentation: 


### Why It Matters What We Do
Because real results don‚Äôt come from empty words‚Äîthey come from action, alignment, and relentless connection.
At 434‚ÄØMedia‚Äîright here in San Antonio‚Äîwe bridge the divide between creativity and outcomes. We‚Äôre not just storytellers; we‚Äôre strategic connectors that bring brands, innovators, and communities together through high-impact, ROI-driven content that moves people to act. We do this by leveraging niche audiences and executing precision-targeted content at scale‚Äîso every project we touch delivers meaningful results.‚ÄØ
Why does it matter? Because consistency is the foundation of trust. As we noted in our own reflections, ‚ÄúProgress isn‚Äôt accidental‚Äîit‚Äôs deliberate,‚Äù and consistency is strategy. In a city where tech, culture, and policy intersect daily, that trust powers real transformation.‚ÄØ
And it matters because we don‚Äôt just show up‚Äîwe stay connected. Whether centering life‚Äëscience innovation like the AIM Conference, nurturing local creatives alongside Latinx storytellers, or capturing moments that honor community resilience, what we do amplifies voices and builds bridges across culture, industry, and identity.‚ÄØ

### Statement (options you can adapt)
Option A:
‚ÄúIt matters what we do because action with intention builds trust‚Äîand trust fuels transformation. At 434‚ÄØMedia, we don‚Äôt simply create content‚Äîwe forge connections. Through consistent, creative, and measurable storytelling, we connect brands to audiences, innovators to impact, and communities to their own narratives. That‚Äôs why what we do matters.‚Äù
Option B:
‚ÄúWhat we do matters because creativity without purpose is just noise. We believe that aligned intent, strategic consistency, and genuine connection transform stories into movements. In the places where tech, culture, and identity collide‚Äîlike here in San Antonio‚Äîwe make it clear: when you see our work, you don‚Äôt just witness it‚Äîyou join it.‚Äù

### Why This Matters for You
‚Ä¢ Aligns with your core mission: Emphasizes measurable impact, ROI, and strategic storytelling.
‚Ä¢ Reinforces 434‚ÄØMedia‚Äôs values: Trust through consistency, action over words, and community-rooted storytelling.
‚Ä¢ Connects emotion with strategy: Shows that what you do isn‚Äôt just creative‚Äîit catalyzes real change and engagement.
